Reviews.Title: problem
Reviews.Author: ahithaphel
Reviews.Content: The t-mobile phone was advertized as almost new. the phone worked for three weeks and then on a trip to Nashville, TN when I shut the phone off. When I turned phone on it needed a password. I stopped at t-mobile and they advised that the operating system had been changed over to Android system, which made the phone inoperable. To say the least this was a problem on our trip and continues to be of no use.I feel the phone was not represented properly. Please advise what recourse we have. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Very solid phone
Reviews.Author: R. Novak
Reviews.Content: Had my phone for 2.5 years and it has served me well. Will continue to use it until it ceases to function. With the included silicone skin, the phone will handle drops with ease. Make sure you use a class 4 or better mSD card

Reviews.Title: HTC HD2 is awsome..
Reviews.Author: R. Ramsey "RRLEO"
Reviews.Content: Pros: The phone is great. I'm using SPB Shell 3.5 Demo 15day trial right now, and I'm loving it. I canceled my Cox Internet because I use HD2 for internet sharing app/its free sharing. There's an app that can make the HD2 5 devices for data plan (handango.com). The music sounds great when I connect to my truck for mp3 music. Videos playing dvd quality also. Pictures are high resolution. Great for entertainment value.Cons: There is a lock up issue. Unplug/battery away from your Smart Phone/computer/laptop at least 30 minutes to reboot. Battery life lasts about 1 day, so keep charger cable/outlet plug near you.

Reviews.Title: Excelent product!
Reviews.Author: Alb
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good and not so expensive Android phone, so you will ask: Why an HD2 then? It comes with Windows Mobile not Android OS. Well the answer for this is that the T-mobile HD2 is a great piece of hardware! 1Ghz cpu, 512+ of RAM and 1Gb of internal storage, but lacks of a good OS. Windows Mobile 6.1 and 6.5 are coming to an end as Windows Phone 7 arrives. So I looked at the XDA Developer Forums for a good phone capable of Android and felt in love with this PPC, so if you want an Android phone quite close to a HTC Desire without spending $400-$500 this is a good choise! Plus there's a chanse it could run WPH7 too!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Very nice person, would definitely buy from him again. Awesome communication, item was as described with no tricks, the phone I got works great.
